content:
TimelineGroup Class

Definition

Abstract class that, when implemented represents a Timeline that may contain a collection of child Timeline objects.

In this Article

[ECMA2Yaml.Models.ECMAAttribute]
public abstract class TimelineGroup : System.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline, System.Windows.Markup.IAddChild

Remarks

A TimelineGroup can be a child of another TimelineGroup.

Child Timeline objects of the TimelineGroup. The default value is null.

Methods

AddChild(Object)

Adds a child Timeline to this TimelineGroup.

protected virtual void AddChild (object child);
Parameters
child
Object

The object to be added as the child of this TimelineGroup. If this object is a Timeline it will be added to the stem.Windows.Media.Animation.TimelineGroup.Children* collection; otherwise, an exception will be thrown.

Attributes
EditorBrowsableAttribute
Exceptions
ArgumentException

The parameter child is not a Timeline.

AddText(String)

Adds a text string as a child of this Timeline.

protected virtual void AddText (string childText);
Parameters
childText
String

The text added to the Timeline.

Attributes
EditorBrowsableAttribute

Remarks

A Timeline does not accept text as a child, so this method will raise an InvalididOperationException unless a derived class has overridden this behavior which allows text to be added.

AllocateClock()

Creates a type-specific clock for this timeline.

protected override System.Windows.Media.Animation.Clock AllocateClock ();
Returns
Clock

A clock for this timeline.

Attributes
ContentPropertyAttribute

Remarks

If a derived class overrides this method, it should only create and return an object of a class inheriting from Clock.

Clone()

Creates a modifiable clone of this TimelineGroup, making deep copies of this object's values. When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.

public System.Windows.Media.Animation.TimelineGroup Clone ();
Returns
TimelineGroup

A modifiable clone of the current object. The cloned object's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property will be false even if the source's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property was true.

Attributes
ContentPropertyAttribute

Remarks

This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen Freezable objects (or any Freezable object). For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.

For more information, see Clone.

CloneCurrentValue()

Creates a modifiable clone of this TimelineGroup object, making deep copies of this object's current values. Resource references, data bindings, and animations are not copied, but their current values are.

public System.Windows.Media.Animation.TimelineGroup CloneCurrentValue ();
Returns
TimelineGroup

A modifiable clone of the current object. The cloned object's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property will be false even if the source's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property was true.

Attributes
ContentPropertyAttribute

Remarks

This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen Freezable objects (or any Freezable object). For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.

For more information, see CloneCurrentValue.
